refnamediv.refpurpose: constructing menus and toolbars from an XML description

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Signal Prototypes
refsect1.synopsis: "actions-changed" void user_function (GtkUIManager *merge, gpointer user_data); "add-widget" void user_function (GtkUIManager *merge, GtkWidget *widget, gpointer user_data); "connect-proxy" void user_function (GtkUIManager *uimanager, GtkAction *arg1, GtkWidget *widget, gpointer user_data); "disconnect-proxy" void user_function (GtkUIManager *uimanager, GtkAction *arg1, GtkWidget *widget, gpointer user_data); "post-activate" void user_function (GtkUIManager *uimanager, GtkAction *arg1, gpointer user_data); "pre-activate" void user_function (GtkUIManager *uimanager, GtkAction *arg1, gpointer user_data);

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A GtkUIManager constructs a user interface (menus and toolbars) from one or more UI definitions, which reference actions from one or more action groups.

refsect2.title: UI Definitions
refsect2.para:
The UI definitions are specified in an XML format which can be roughly described by the following DTD.
<!ELEMENT ui (menubar|toolbar|popup|accelerator)* > <!ELEMENT menubar (menuitem|separator|placeholder|menu)* > <!ELEMENT menu (menuitem|separator|placeholder|menu)* > <!ELEMENT popup (menuitem|separator|placeholder|menu)* > <!ELEMENT toolbar (toolitem|separator|placeholder)* > <!ELEMENT placeholder (menuitem|toolitem|separator|placeholder|menu)* > <!ELEMENT menuitem EMPTY > <!ELEMENT toolitem EMPTY > <!ELEMENT separator EMPTY > <!ELEMENT accelerator EMPTY > <!ATTLIST menubar name #IMPLIED > <!ATTLIST toolbar name #IMPLIED > <!ATTLIST popup name #IMPLIED > <!ATTLIST placeholder name #IMPLIED > <!ATTLIST menu name #IMPLIED action #REQUIRED position (top|bot) #IMPLIED > <!ATTLIST menuitem name #IMPLIED action #REQUIRED position (top|bot) #IMPLIED > <!ATTLIST toolitem name #IMPLIED action #REQUIRED position (top|bot) #IMPLIED > <!ATTLIST accelerator name #IMPLIED action #REQUIRED >
There are some additional restrictions beyond those specified in the DTD, e.g. every toolitem must have a toolbar in its anchestry and every menuitem must have a menubar or popup in its anchestry. Since a GMarkup parser is used to parse the UI description, it must not only be valid XML, but valid GMarkup. If a name is not specified, it defaults to the action. If an action is not specified either, the element name is used.

example.title: A UI definition
example.programlisting: <ui> <menubar> <menu name="FileMenu" action="FileMenuAction"> <menuitem name="New" action="New2Action" /> <placeholder name="FileMenuAdditions" /> </menu> <menu name="JustifyMenu" action="JustifyMenuAction"> <menuitem name="Left" action="justify-left"/> <menuitem name="Centre" action="justify-center"/> <menuitem name="Right" action="justify-right"/> <menuitem name="Fill" action="justify-fill"/> </menu> </menubar> <toolbar action="toolbar1"> <placeholder name="JustifyToolItems"> <separator/> <toolitem name="Left" action="justify-left"/> <toolitem name="Centre" action="justify-center"/> <toolitem name="Right" action="justify-right"/> <toolitem name="Fill" action="justify-fill"/> <separator/> </placeholder> </toolbar> </ui>

refsect2.para:
The constructed widget hierarchy is very similar to the element tree of the XML, with the exception that placeholders are merged into their parents. The correspondence of XML elements to widgets should be almost obvious:
menubar
a GtkMenuBar
toolbar
a GtkToolbar
popup
a toplevel GtkMenu
menu
a GtkMenu attached to a menuitem
menuitem
a GtkMenuItem subclass, the exact type depends on the action
toolitem
a GtkToolItem subclass, the exact type depends on the action
separator
a GtkSeparatorMenuItem or GtkSeparatorToolItem
accelerator
a keyboard accelerator
The "position" attribute determines where a constructed widget is positioned wrt. to its siblings in the partially constructed tree. If it is "top", the widget is prepended, otherwise it is appended.

refsect2.title: UI Merging
refsect2.para: The most remarkable feature of GtkUIManager is that it can overlay a set of menuitems and toolitems over another one, and demerge them later.

Merging is done based on the name of the XML elements. Each element is identified by a path which consists of the names of its anchestors, separated by slashes. For example, the menuitem named "Left" in the example above has the path /ui/menubar/JustifyMenu/Left and the toolitem with the same name has path /ui/toolbar1/JustifyToolItems/Left.

refsect2.title: Accelerators
refsect2.para: Every action has an accelerator path. Accelerators are installed together with menuitem proxies, but they can also be explicitly added with <accelerator> elements in the UI definition. This makes it possible to have accelerators for actions even if they have no visible proxies.

refsect2.title: Smart Separators
refsect2.para: The separators created by GtkUIManager are "smart", i.e. they do not show up in the UI unless they end up between two visible menu or tool items. Separators which are located at the very beginning or end of the menu or toolbar containing them, or multiple separators next to each other, are hidden. This is a useful feature, since the merging of UI elements from multiple sources can make it hard or impossible to determine in advance whether a separator will end up in such an unfortunate position.

refsect2.title: Empty Menus
refsect2.para:
Submenus pose similar problems to separators inconnection with merging. It is impossible to know in advance whether they will end up empty after merging. GtkUIManager offers two ways to treat empty submenus:
make them disappear by hiding the menu item they're attached to
add an insensitive "Empty" item
The behaviour is chosen based on the "is_important" property of the action to which the submenu is associated.

refsect2.title: struct GtkUIManager
refsect2.para: The GtkUIManager struct contains only private members and should not be accessed directly.

refsect2.title: gtk_ui_manager_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new ui manager object.
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_ui_manager_set_add_tearoffs ()
refsect2.para: Sets the "add_tearoffs" property, which controls whether menus generated by this GtkUIManager will have tearoff menu items.
Note that this only affects regular menus. Generated popup menus never have tearoff menu items.

listitem.simpara: whether tearoff menu items are added

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_ui_manager_get_add_tearoffs ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether menus generated by this GtkUIManager will have tearoff menu items.

listitem.simpara: whether tearoff menu items are added

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_ui_manager_insert_action_group ()
refsect2.para: Inserts an action group into the list of action groups associated with self. Actions in earlier groups hide actions with the same name in later groups.

listitem.simpara: the action group to be inserted
the position at which the group will be inserted.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_ui_manager_remove_action_group ()
refsect2.para: Removes an action group from the list of action groups associated with self.

listitem.simpara: the action group to be removed

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_ui_manager_get_action_groups ()
refsect2.para: Returns the list of action groups associated with self.

listitem.simpara: a GList of action groups. The list is owned by GTK+ and should not be modified.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_ui_manager_get_accel_group ()
refsect2.para: Returns the GtkAccelGroup associated with self.
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_ui_manager_get_widget ()
refsect2.para: Looks up a widget by following a path. The path consists of the names specified in the XML description of the UI. separated by '/'. Elements which don't have a name or action attribute in the XML (e.g. <popup>) can be addressed by their XML element name (e.g. "popup"). The root element ("/ui") can be omitted in the path.

listitem.simpara: the widget found by following the path, or NULL if no widget was found.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_ui_manager_get_toplevels ()
refsect2.para: Obtains a list of all toplevel widgets of the requested types.

listitem.simpara: specifies the types of toplevel widgets to include. Allowed types are GTK_UI_MANAGER_MENUBAR, GTK_UI_MANAGER_TOOLBAR and GTK_UI_MANAGER_POPUP.
a newly-allocated of all toplevel widgets of the requested types.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_ui_manager_get_action ()
refsect2.para: Looks up an action by following a path. See gtk_ui_manager_get_widget() for more information about paths.

listitem.simpara: the action whose proxy widget is found by following the path, or NULL if no widget was found.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_ui_manager_add_ui_from_string ()
refsect2.programlisting: guint gtk_ui_manager_add_ui_from_string (GtkUIManager *self, const gchar *buffer, gssize length, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Parses a string containing a UI definition and merges it with the current contents of self. An enclosing <ui> element is added if it is missing.

listitem.simpara: the length of buffer (may be -1 if buffer is nul-terminated)
The merge id for the merged UI. The merge id can be used to unmerge the UI with gtk_ui_manager_remove_ui(). If an error occurred, the return value is 0.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_ui_manager_add_ui_from_file ()
refsect2.para: Parses a file containing a UI definition and merges it with the current contents of self.

listitem.simpara: the name of the file to parse
The merge id for the merged UI. The merge id can be used to unmerge the UI with gtk_ui_manager_remove_ui(). If an error occurred, the return value is 0.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_ui_manager_new_merge_id ()
refsect2.para: Returns an unused merge id, suitable for use with gtk_ui_manager_add_ui().
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: enum GtkUIManagerItemType
refsect2.programlisting: typedef enum { GTK_UI_MANAGER_AUTO = 0, GTK_UI_MANAGER_MENUBAR = 1 << 0, GTK_UI_MANAGER_MENU = 1 << 1, GTK_UI_MANAGER_TOOLBAR = 1 << 2, GTK_UI_MANAGER_PLACEHOLDER = 1 << 3, GTK_UI_MANAGER_POPUP = 1 << 4, GTK_UI_MANAGER_MENUITEM = 1 << 5, GTK_UI_MANAGER_TOOLITEM = 1 << 6, GTK_UI_MANAGER_SEPARATOR = 1 << 7, GTK_UI_MANAGER_ACCELERATOR = 1 << 8 } GtkUIManagerItemType;
refsect2.para: These enumeration values are used by gtk_ui_manager_add_ui() to determine what UI element to create.

listitem.simpara: Pick the type of the UI element according to context.

refsect2.title: gtk_ui_manager_add_ui ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_ui_manager_add_ui (GtkUIManager *self, guint merge_id, const gchar *path, const gchar *name, const gchar *action, GtkUIManagerItemType type, gboolean top);
refsect2.para: Adds a UI element to the current contents of self.

If type is GTK_UI_MANAGER_AUTO, GTK+ inserts a menuitem, toolitem or separator if such an element can be inserted at the place determined by path. Otherwise type must indicate an element that can be inserted at the place determined by path.

listitem.simpara: the merge id for the merged UI, see gtk_ui_manager_new_merge_id()
the name for the added UI element
the name of the action to be proxied, or NULL to add a separator
the type of UI element to add.
if TRUE, the UI element is added before its siblings, otherwise it is added after its siblings.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_ui_manager_remove_ui ()
refsect2.para: Unmerges the part of selfs content identified by merge_id.

listitem.simpara: a merge id as returned by gtk_ui_manager_add_ui_from_string()

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_ui_manager_get_ui ()
refsect2.para: Creates a UI definition of the merged UI.

listitem.simpara: A newly allocated string containing an XML representation of the merged UI.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_ui_manager_ensure_update ()
refsect2.para: Makes sure that all pending updates to the UI have been completed.
Since 2.4

listitem.para: The "add-tearoffs" property controls whether generated menus have tearoff menu items.
Note that this only affects regular menus. Generated popup menus never have tearoff menu items.
An XML string describing the merged UI.

refsect2.title: The "actions-changed" signal
refsect2.para: The "actions-changed" signal is emitted whenever the set of actions changes.

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: The "add-widget" signal
refsect2.para: The add_widget signal is emitted for each generated menubar and toolbar. It is not emitted for generated popup menus, which can be obtained by gtk_ui_manager_get_widget().

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: The "connect-proxy" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkUIManager *uimanager, GtkAction *arg1, GtkWidget *widget, gpointer user_data);

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "disconnect-proxy" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkUIManager *uimanager, GtkAction *arg1, GtkWidget *widget, gpointer user_data);

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
